variant.p: Examples of other IFRSs that provide guidance on subsequently measuring and accounting for assets acquired and liabilities assumed or incurred in a business combination include:

li.p: IAS 38 prescribes the accounting for identifiable intangible assets acquired in a business combination. The acquirer measures goodwill at the amount recognised at the acquisition date less any accumulated impairment losses. IAS 36 Impairment of Assets prescribes the accounting for impairment losses.
IAS 12 prescribes the subsequent accounting for deferred tax assets (including unrecognised deferred tax assets) and liabilities acquired in a business combination.
IFRS 2 provides guidance on subsequent measurement and accounting for the portion of replacement share‑based payment awards issued by an acquirer that is attributable to employees’ future services.
IFRS 10 provides guidance on accounting for changes in a parent’s ownership interest in a subsidiary after control is obtained.
